review.p1: Before we begin, let’s take a moment to review what you committed to last time.
review.p2: This helps us encourage each other and see how God is at work.
review.empty: You didn’t write any notes in Look Forward the last time we met. Taking a few notes can help you grow!

para.1: Many people pause at the start of a new season to reflect on life, relationships, and the direction they are heading.
para.2: This site invites you to explore a collection of ancient stories and recorded teachings that have shaped how many people understand wisdom, purpose, and the way to live well.

jvideo.title: Exploring the Source
jvideo.summary: Short videos introduce Jesus and invite you to observe his teachings and actions.

para.1: As you watch, notice what Jesus says and does. Consider how his approach to wisdom compares with other voices and traditions you are familiar with.

ctc.title: The Larger Story
ctc.summary: These stories trace a larger narrative that begins before people appear.

para.1: The stories present wisdom through a connected account of people, choices, and relationships with God over time.
para.2: You are invited to read these stories together and reflect on what they suggest about life, meaning, and responsibility.

life.title: Wisdom for Everyday Life
life.summary: These passages explore practical themes such as relationships, integrity, forgiveness, and decision-making.

para.1: Jesus and his early followers spoke about everyday issues that many people still face today.
para.2: As you read and discuss these passages, consider what stands out to you and whether any of these ideas connect with your own experience of life.

question.title: Questions and Conversation
question.summary: If you have questions or would like to share your thoughts, you are welcome to start a conversation.
